delivered in different ways too some of this software is delivered as a service so it's a website you go to to access

striving to do we love selling things in amazon.com but we're also a resource where people come to learn about the

right software inside AWS Marketplace the second problem is that buying software can be hard it can be a
long process it can be a process that lacks trans transparency we strive to make it easier
to buy software and faster to buy software so some of the some of the things that we do is have really

to purchase that software if you are already an AWS customer you have an invoice set up with
AWS or you have a credit card already set up when you buy software on Marketplace those hourly and monthly
charges appear on the very same bill you already get from AWS and they're build against the very same credit card or
invoice you've already set up with AWS so streamlining that process too making it easier to
buy whoa third is about how we license
software I mentioned we sell software by the hour now this is important because of how ec2 is sold back in 2006 AWS
released ec2 the compute Cloud which allows people to buy servers by the hour
so when their needs increase they can add more servers when their needs decrease they can remove servers and
they can do this continually at any point they want and they're build by the hour for these changes that that's great
and it stimulated a lot of really fantastic Innovation over the last five or so years but commercial software
today doesn't generally scale the same way often it scales by the year so if
you're running an app server that is designed to scale up and scale down as your psychs hit more or hit less that's
fantastic you can do that with ec2 but if you're running some commercial software on top of it well if you scale
up you're going to buy another Year's worth of license it makes it less cost- effective and not as feasible well with
Marketplace we sell software that is sold by the hour just like our servers making it so that your software can sell
as well and as seamlessly as your servers now scale too to recap we make make it easier for
people to find the software they need we do this by basing on well tried retail
technology we make it easier for them to buy it by using existing payment

to run in the AWS Cloud both by scaling the same way that ec2 scales but also

ond demand version of Hana same product but it runs in AWS and it's delivered via Marketplace for a dollar an hour so

feedback that we've heard from isv partners that are listing on AWS Marketplace um is that we help to Short
Circuit the sales cycle in many cases with with all size customers and one of
the ways that we do that is by enabling both field Salesforce and demand gen
engines that they're running to drive customers to the marketplace um as a
fulfillment Channel and for example we know that customer acquisition is expensive we have a field Salesforce

that are short circuited um one is the license agreement so your license agreement is actually embedded inside of

your license terms the second is that you control the pricing on the marketplace that pricing that's
displayed is not negotiated by those customers so that part of the sales
cycle where you typically have to negotiate with a customer over the pricing terms of a Perpetual or
long-term license that goes away and the third part is the overall
contract that agreement that the customer is signing up to use your software again is embedded inside that
oneclick experience so those three components of the customer sales cycle
those get driven into Marketplace and shortened in many cases um but from a
